abstract.para: The &selnx; tool enables you to switch between &selnx; modes and view current modifications of the &selnx; policy.

important.title: Missing &selnx; module
important.para: The &selnx; &cockpit; module is visible only if &selnx; is enabled on the system. If you cannot access the module, &selnx; is probably disabled. To check that &selnx; is enabled, run:

topic.para: On &productname;, &selnx; is in the enforcing mode by default. To temporarily switch to the permissive mode, click the button with the Enforcing label. Note that the change persists only until the next boot. If you need to perform a persistent change of the mode, edit the configuration file /etc/selinux/config. For details, refer to the Security Guide.

The System modifications lists all modifications performed on the default &selnx; policy. If you want to export the modifications and reuse them on different servers, click View automation script. In the new window, you can copy a shell script or the Ansible configuration file that can be applied on other servers.
